ratings.comment: Todd is a great professor-- I just really didn't like the structure of the class. The semester-long group project is nearly impossible to collaborate on, and I really didn't know what was going on half the time.

Todd was a very enjoyable professor for soc140. He seems to really care for his students and I enjoyed how he offered many ways to earn extra credit. The class is also pretty low effort which I really like. As long as you do the readings (they take about an hour so not bad) and listen to the class discussion, you will excel. Also no exams!

Todd is a really nice and likable guy but the format for this class is a little bit odd. The lectures are essentially group discussions and instead of midterms and a final exam, there are biweekly quizzes which are definitely difficult. The discussion section is very demanding with a very difficult and heavily weighted project.

Todd was a good professor. He cares about his students, but his style is very different from most. The pod setup and class lecture are practically a discussion for the whole period, but the content is interesting. Be sure to ask questions if you are confused about the bi-weekly quizzes. They're worded weirdly and easy to do poorly on.

He is a nice guy and cares about his students. Its about 15 pages of easy reading for two days/week takes like 2 hours max/week. Lectures are participation based with students talking instead of him. The quizzes are tough but if you do the readings you will do well. A bad thing is that instead of a final, there is a group project but its easy.
He's terrible, don't do it to yourself.

The absolute worst professor ever. He is awful at teaching the material because you don't even have a lecture, you just have a large discussion during lecture time, and during discussion time you work on an impossible project that is worth 35% of your grade. He never puts in grades until the last week when you can't do anything about them.The worst
